products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-slz-vpc
products.label: VPC landing zone
products.short_description: Deploys a secure VPC network without compute resources
products.long_description: The VPC landing zone deployable architecture deploys a simple Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) infrastructure without any compute resources, such as Virtual Server Instances (VSI) or Red Hat OpenShift clusters. You can use this architecture as a base on which to deploy compute resources. Or you can deploy those resources by using the other landing zone deployable architectures: [VSI on VPC landing zone](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-slz-vsi-ef663980-4c71-4fac-af4f-4a510a9bcf68-global) and [Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-slz-ocp-95fccffc-ae3b-42df-b6d9-80be5914d852-global).

features.title: Configures subnets

features.description: The transit gateway connects the two default VPCs that the deployable architecture creates.
features.title: Creates a transit gateway

features.description: IBM Cloud Object Storage is used for Flow Logs and Activity Tracker, which enhance the observability and auditing of your infrastructure.
features.title: Integrates Flow Logs and Activity tracking

features.description: Isolates and speeds traffic to the public internet by using an edge VPC in a specific location, if enabled.
features.title: Supports edge networking

diagrams.description: The Standard variation of the VPC landing zone deployable architecture deploys a simple Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) infrastructure without any compute resources. You can use this architecture as a base on which to deploy compute resources. The Standard variation uses two Virtual Private Clouds (VPC) - a Management VPC and a Workload VPC - to manage the environment and the deployed workload. Each VPC is a multi-zoned, multi-subnet implementation that keeps your workloads secure. A transit gateway connects the VPCs to each other and Virtual Private Endpoints are used connect to IBM Cloud services.

products.short_description: Creates Red Hat OpenShift workload clusters on a secure VPC network
products.long_description: The Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone provides the tools to deploy a Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform cluster in a single Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network. diagram.caption: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone - QuickStart variation

diagrams.description:
The QuickStart variation of the Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone deployable architecture creates one Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform cluster in workload VPC with two worker nodes and public endpoint enabled.

This variation includes integration with IBM Key Protect for managing the cluster encryption keys and requires a Cloud Object Storage instance for provisioning the cluster.

The QuickStart variation is designed to help you get started quickly, but is not highly available or validated for the IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services.

diagram.caption: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone - Standard variation

diagrams.description:
The Standard variation of the Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone is based on the IBM Cloud for Financial Services reference architecture.

It increases security with Key Management , reduces failure events by using multizone regions, and collects and stores Internet Protocol (IP) traffic information through Activity Tracker and Flow Logs. It securely connects to multiple networks using a site-to-site virtual private network and configures existing CBR (Context-based Restrictions) rules to restrict traffic flow only between landing zone VPCs and specific IBM Cloud services.

The architecture creates secure and compliant Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform workload clusters on a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network.
